intro: Heteromorpha arborescens var. abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian tree heath, is a shrub or small tree native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its flowers are small, white or pink, and it produces small, woody fruits. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
